channel.title: TeamTorva Errors
channel.description: [font=comic sans ms]I downloaded the source, "TorvaPkz v3" but it won't let me use the compiler. Apparently the path cannot be specified? Also, when I try to make a WebClient, it says my server is offline. Can someone please help me?[/font]

You would need java update 6 u 24 for it to run on.

item.title: TeamTorva Errors
item.dc:creator: @dylan.hurley dylan.hurley
item.description:
@dylan.hurley wrote:

i here is a guide for dummys go to c drive and search for javac.exe if 2+ come up then look for 1 with a folder with jdk in the name and another with the name bin then thats the file u use when for location you put where it is eg if its in c drive abc folder jdk folder bin folder javac.exe when put c:\abc\jdk\javac.exe

Read full topic

item.title: TeamTorva Errors
item.dc:creator: @TeamSeek TeamSeek
item.description:
@TeamSeek wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:8, topic:414627”]Try replacing your:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe”

With this:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe”

As seen above that’s for my java version “24” change it to what yours is of course.[/quote] That’s what mine is… jdk1.7.0 … Do I have to have 1.6.0_24?

Read full topic

item.title: TeamTorva Errors

item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Try replacing your:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe”

With this:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe”

As seen above that’s for my java version “24” change it to what yours is of course.

item.dc:creator: @dylan.hurley dylan.hurley
item.description:
@dylan.hurley wrote:

dude it has the file location when you do edit so change it to where your javac.exe is you also mite have fishglass which is like jdk and java together for that you do “C:\glassfish3\jdk\bin\javac.exe” if all this fails then you downloaded the wrong jdk

item.title: TeamTorva Errors
item.dc:creator: @TeamSeek TeamSeek
item.description:
@TeamSeek wrote:

[quote=“Aaroninsane, post:3, topic:414627”]edit the compiler and change it it your version of jdk[/quote][font=times new roman] I’ve done that many, many times. Do you have 1.7.0? If you do, send me what the file should look like? The compiler one. Here’s what mine is,

“@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java src/server/gui/*.java
pause”

Send me what it looks like in yours, if the compiler works then i could copy and paste it into my file.[/font]

Read full topic
